intro: Haplodictyum exiguum, commonly known as the small-haploid moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its diminutive, compact growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a short, creeping stem with closely spaced leaves that are often curved at the tips. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Haplodictyum exiguum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
